column1: # Please provide an informal yet informative name of the method used.
# All major software packages used and their versions.
Alchemical free energy calculations were performed in explicit

column2: following the protocol described in [1].  We used "wet"

column1: octanol (water content 27 mol %).  Parameters were generated with
Antechamber from AmberTools and ACPYPE for AMBER (GAFF) with the TIP3P
water model. Files were prepared for Gromacs 2018. The alchemical data
were analyzed with thermodynamic integration. Errors are reported as
errors of the mean (see [1]). The model uncertainty was estimated on
the basis of an unpublished data set of 92 compounds for which we
computed errors for solvation free energies in water and octanol.  [1]

column3: and B. I. Iorga. Prediction of

column1: cyclohexane-water distribution coefficients for the SAMPL5 data set
using molecular dynamics simulations with the OPLS-AA force field. J
